@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2011 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Christian Hagendorn (chris_schmidt) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A drop-down (popup) widget which contains a virtual list for selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the drop-down list.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Current selected items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Allow the drop-down to grow wider than its parent.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Position of the aligned object in relation to the opener. Please note than changes to this property are only applied when re-aligning the widget. The first part of the value is the edge to attach to. The second part the alignment of the orthogonal edge after the widget has been attached. The default value "bottom-left" for example means that the widget should be shown directly under the given target and then should be aligned to be left edge: 

 +--------+
 | target |
 +--------+
 +-------------+
 |   widget    |
 +-------------+

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget should be placed relative to an other widget or to the pointer.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget should moved using DOM methods.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects the algorithm to place the widget horizontally. direct uses {@link qx.util.placement.DirectAxis}, keep-align uses {@link qx.util.placement.KeepAlignAxis} and best-fit uses {@link qx.util.placement.BestFitAxis}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects the algorithm to place the widget vertically. direct uses {@link qx.util.placement.DirectAxis}, keep-align uses {@link qx.util.placement.KeepAlignAxis} and best-fit uses {@link qx.util.placement.BestFitAxis}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Left offset of the pointer (in pixel)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Top offset of the pointer (in pixel)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Right offset of the pointer (in pixel)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Bottom offset of the pointer (in pixel)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Offsets in one group

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
This event is fired as soon as the content of the selection property changes, but this is not equal to the change of the selection of the widget. If the selection of the widget changes, the content of the array stored in the selection property changes. This means you have to listen to the change event of the selection array to get an event as soon as the user changes the selected item. 

obj.getSelection().addListener("change", listener, this);

@type.name: @type
@type.body:
{Boolean} Indicator to ignore selection changes from the
 {@link #selection} array.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Boolean} Indicator to ignore selection changes from the list.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: When the drop-down is allowed to grow wider than its parent, this member variable will contain the cached maximum list item width in pixels. This variable gets updated whenever the model or model length changes.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Shows the drop-down.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Hides the drop-down.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Pre-selects the drop-down item corresponding to the given model object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handles the complete keyboard events dispatched on the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handles all mouse events dispatched on the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the local selection change. The method is responsible for the synchronization between the own selection and the selection form the drop-down.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the selection change on the list. The method is responsible for the synchronization between the list selection and the own selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the own visibility changes. The method is responsible that the list selects the current selected item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the model change event. Called when the whole model changes, not when its length changes.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the model length change event. Called whenever items get added or removed from the model, not when the model itself changes.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the delegate change event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method to select the current preselected item, also closes the drop-down.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method to synchronize both selection. The target selection has the same selection like the source selection after the synchronization.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adjust the drop-down to the available width and height, by calling {@link #adjustWidth} and {@link #adjustHeight}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adjust the drop-down to the available width. The width is limited by the current width from the _target, unless allowGrowDropDown is true.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adjust the drop-down to the available height. Ensure that the list is never bigger that the max list height and the available space in the viewport.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calculates the available height in the viewport.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Loop over all model items to recalculate the maximum list item width.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the cached maximum list item width.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the location data like {qx.bom.element.Location#get} does, but does not rely on DOM elements coordinates to be rendered. Instead, this method works with the available layout data available in the moment when it is executed. This works best when called in some type of resize or move event which are supported by all widgets out of the box.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map|null} Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the widget relative coords the document.
@return.description: Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the widget relative coords the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the position. Uses low-level, high-performance DOM methods when the property {@link #domMove} is enabled. Checks if an always visible element is set and moves the widget to not overlay the always visible widget if possible. The algorithm tries to move the widget as far left as necessary but not of the screen. ({@link #setVisibleElement})

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to another (at least laid out) widget. The DOM element is not needed, but the bounds are needed to compute the location of the widget to align to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
liveupdate {Boolean} Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.
@param.description:
Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the widget was successfully placed
@return.description: true if the widget was successfully placed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all resources allocated by the last run of placeToWidget with liveupdate=true

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to the pointer position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: event {qx.event.type.Pointer} Pointer event to align to

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to any (rendered) DOM element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: elem {Element} DOM element to align to

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
liveupdate {Boolean} Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.
@param.description:
Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget in relation to the given point

@param.name: @param
@param.body: point {Map} Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.
@param.description: Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the placement offsets as a map

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the size of the object to place. The callback will be called with the size as first argument. This methods works asynchronously. The size of the object to place is the size of the widget. If a widget including this mixin needs a different size it can implement the method _computePlacementSize, which returns the size.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
callback {Function} This function will be called with the size as
    first argument
@param.description:
This function will be called with the size as
    first argument

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal method to read specific this properties and apply the results to the this afterwards.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: coords {Map} Location of the object to align the this to. This map should have the keys left, top, right and bottom.
@param.description: Location of the object to align the this to. This map should have the keys left, top, right and bottom.
